name: Holiday Inn Los Angeles International Airport

reviews.text: The wireless internet broke down while we were staying there. They have free apples.
reviews.title: A great hotel, but wireless internet broke down

reviews.text: Admittedly the hotel was clean and the room was nice, however, the shuttle service was AWFUL!!! I arrived at 11pm on a Sunday and had to catch a 6:30 am flight the next morning, so I chose the hotel specifically because of the shuttle. I waited 25 minutes and then the shuttle drove right passed me, not even stopping at terminal 5 where I was waiting--and it was NOT full. I called the hotel and they said they would send it back "the quick way"....another 20 minutes later it showed up. I would have rather spent an extra $100 and stayed at another hotel....almost all had 4 shuttles go by while I was waiting for the Holiday Inn....except for the Courtyard Marriott...a couple was waiting even longer than me!
reviews.title: Don't stay here if you need to use the shuttle!!!
Reasonable for the price
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for one night during January 2005. There is a free shuttle bus from LAX to the hotel, just ring the hotel from LAX and it will come to pick you up. Likewise, heading back to the airport, the free shuttle bus runs every 10-15 minutes 24 hrs.

reviews.title: A Good Hotel for a Stopover
reviews.text: The hotels itself are average, TV, bathroom, bed. For a one-night stay you can't complain for the price, but I wouldn't recommend basing yourself here for any more than a day.
The first room I was assigned to smelt of smoke (despite being on a non-smoking floor), but after seeing the concierge they were able to change me to another room, with no problems.
reviews.title: Did not meet Holiday Inn standards
Yuck and Double Yuck
reviews.text: Right within walking distance of the hotel is a drive through Macdonalds (literally metres away from the hotel lobby), and a gas station/convenience store right next to that. Pizza Hut and Taco Bell are down the road. Across the street was an Internet cafe, which closes until quite late, around 10pm.

Very convenient to the airport. Clean, big rooms, friendly staff. I am not sure what else you need! This is not a hotel for a vacation after all it is a business and stay overnight kind of place for LAX. Hotel restaurant was very good both for dinner and breakfast (Landings) and medium priced. Did not check out pool or fitness center. I am not sure what the complaint was about the shuttle to the airport. It ran every 20 minutes 24 hours a day. Driver courteous and helpful. Desk staff very friendly and helpful. Being just off Century Blvd and the 405 freeway there was a lot of traffic noise all through the night and if you are a light sleeper ask for a room on the opposite side. I would expect any hotel near the airport would have the same problem as most are on Century Blvd. Beside the traffice noise, the business center was very expensive to use so there is an internet cafe across the street at much better rates (although crossing Century blvd was hazardous!). For short stay, hotel was very adequate.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: We spent 1 night at the Holiday Inn coming home from Cancun and were very happy with the hotel and rate. It was definitly a step above the Clarion (which is now La Quinta) which is right next door and where we stayed going to Cancun. Though the Holiday Inn doesn't have a continental breakfast like the Clarion, they have a restraunt for breakfast or Mcdonalds is about 50 yards from the front door. Call to make sure the shuttle is coming or is being sent. We waited about 20 mins and the ride to the hotel was about 5-10 minutes. The shuttle runs every 20 mins leaving the hotel.
reviews.title: Great for the price

reviews.text: I stayed here on 2 occasions and think that its a good, reasonably priced hotel close to LAX.
reviews.title: I'd stay here again

aka: Holiday Inn Los Angeles International Airport Hotel Los Angeles
description: The closest full service Holiday Inn to the Los Angeles Airport with complimentary 24 hour LAX shuttle service. Our central location puts you just minutes away from “everything LA”. Come enjoy places like Disneyland, Universal Studios, Hollywood, Santa Monica, Venice Beach and all that beautiful Southern California has to offer.Stay connected with free high-speed Internet access. Maintain your exercise regimen in our state-of-the-art fitness center. Unwind at Landings Restaurant and Lounge, serving breakfast lunch and dinner, featuring California cuisine and daily specials.The Holiday Inn Los Angeles International Airport–LAX Hotel, where Kids Stay and Eat Free! Credit Card is required at check-in for all guests paying in cash at check-in or upon check-out. Credit Card is also required upon check-in for incidentals regardless if guest intends to not incur incidentals during their stay. We are a 100% Smoke Free Hotel.
